Description: Ostracon (?), large fragment of the rim-section and body of a red pottery jar with slightly flaring sides and rounded lip, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and two lines of incised Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394862) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394862)
